meanings.definition: to make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old door skreeghs when it opens slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate skreeghs loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house skreeghs at midnight, scaring the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The brakes on the car skreeghs like a banshee, signaling danger.
meanings.sent5: The violinist skreeghs out a high note, piercing the silence.

meanings.sent1: The skreeghs of the seagulls filled the air at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The skreeghs of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The skreeghs of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The skreeghs of the brakes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The skreeghs of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
